title: Play Probability Modeling and Text Mining

comment.comment: 描寫太過簡略，不過相信講者能處理好這個 tutorial。Recording Perm 為 CC-BY-NC-SA 加分。

先附上後來整理出來的新稿子:

## 課程簡介

不論你是否已經會寫程式，Python 都是讓你提高自身能力的絕佳工具！

由於 Python 在設計初期，便針對非專業程式設計師的學習而規劃語法，因此十分注重程式碼本身易學、易讀、清晰等特性。這也使得 Python 在近年來，逐漸被廣泛作為「第一個程式語言」教授，讓第一次接觸程式的人，可以避免被太多語法規則分心，專注於程式的概念本身。

對於已有程式設計經驗的人而言，Python 也可以是一個強大的助力。Python 在基本語法之上，規劃了非常豐富的標準函式庫，且經過多年的開發與修正，可以很方便達成、簡化許多任務。這種「batteries included」的特性，讓程式設計師只需要擁有 Python，就可以迅速、簡單的完成各種日常工作，而不需投入過多精力撰寫、管理實作基礎功能所需的程式碼。而對於稍微專門的應用，Python 也提供了管理第三方套件的機制「pip」，讓使用者能夠輕鬆取得超過五萬個函式庫，足以應付絕大多數的程式設計需求。

但 Python 也不只是一個用來撰寫小工具的簡單語言。許多大、中型專案中，都十分大量的使用 Python，尤其在網頁伺服器端開發上，隨著 WSGI 介面被廣泛應用，越來越多網站開始選擇以 Python 建構。在 Python 不足以單獨應付需求的情況下，Python 也提供了與 C、C++、甚至 C# 或者 Java 程式溝通的介面。

## 適合對象

這個課程最適合已經有一點點程式經驗的人；我們會在這個課程中，逐步了解 Python 的各種特性，讓你完整發揮 Python 的功能，完成程式設計時會遇到的問題。但即使你沒有太多程式經驗，也能夠在這個課程中學到基本的 Python 技能，是入門程式設計的好方法。

## 課程大綱

* Python 直譯器基礎
* 基本型別、物件、變數
* 函式
* 例外處理
* Python 程式風格指南：PEP 8
* 內建函式與函式庫
* 如何使用第三方函式庫

## 注意事項

為了課程順暢，教學當天將會假設你已經將 Python 安裝完成。若你擁有自己的筆記型電腦，我們強烈建議可以先在上面安裝 Python 3.4.3，並在教學當天攜帶至課堂上使用。這樣可以保證你未來能夠在自己的電腦上，繼續使用相同的環境，或者也可以經由這次經驗，了解未來如何在其他電腦上建構同樣的環境。

如果你沒有筆記型電腦，教學當天將會提供已經安裝 Python 的桌上型電腦。雖然如此，我們同樣希望你同樣能在自己的電腦上先完成安裝 Python 3.4.3。這樣子，如果在安裝或設定上遇到問題，我們也可以在課程當天協助排除，讓你能夠在未來使用。

注意：本教學將使用 Python 3 進行。即使已經安裝 Python 2，也請麻煩另外按照教學安裝此版本。

Python 3.4.3 安裝教學：https://gist.github.com/uranusjr/6fa2770a8c8651192e93

title: Creating Stories with Python

comment.comment:
His abstract and description are written in detail, so I'll try make my
feedback as solid as I could. Using neural network in Python on vision
recognition is definitely interesting, however I'd like to see a more general
comparison and exploration, so audience can actually "learn" the concept of
neural network and a general experience of the Python implementation after the
talk, so they could play with these take-home messages themselves.

For example, say normal NN models are trained based on backward propagation,
it is good to explain how the backprop works in Python. Numpy may be heavily
used, and there exists some trick for efficient Numpy matrix computation.
Also, it would be a lot easier to create new models (classifiers) if the code
for each neural layer is well modularized. Some popular Python NN libraries
are available, they worth comparison (if one wants to) too. One may wish to
leverage the computing power of GPU once the NN structure gets deeper and
larger. Explaining these general concepts could help audience jump into
the beautiful and fascinating machine learning world.

On the other hand, there leaves some technical stuff to be desired in his NN
structure design judging from a modern NN view. Firstly, the input size is
way too small, using 10-by-10 pixel reduces the real world complexity too much.
Even the MNIST hand written digit recognition dataset has higher input
dimension. This also poses a limiting upper bound for accuracy. Secondly the
model is too simple, most people call this a two-layer (or one hidden layer)
neural network instead of three, where first layer usually doesn't count
(since one "train" the input layer). He should try deeper neural network and
visualizing the weights learnt by the classifier. Current development of
visual NN heavily relies on the idea of convolutional neural network (CNN)
which is biologically inspired so one could actually "visualize" those weights
as colorful filters. We are not talking about the giant corporation-like
ImageNet CNN model with 10+ hidden layers and requires few days to train. One
simple CNN layer plus the fully connected layer would boost the performance
significantly and brings a lot of insight that decades of research finally
achieve and brings up a frenzy of the CNN era, which he should definitely try
it in a 40min talk. Lastly, why 5 types of cats and why not crawl more cats
from the internet? I think by supplying keyword to Flickr one could able to
create a clean and large dataset (at least more than a hundred). Let alone the
*evil* data augmentation process that utilizes cropping, color transformation
for creating more data to alleviate the over-fitting.

Based on the above reason, the talk could be more constructive and
interesting. I believe he is absolutely capable of a successful talk, the last
thing he misses is simply letting the imagination go wild.
認同 liang2 的意見。NN 是非常好用的工具，但最大問題也是其黑箱作業。如果只是使用某種模型來解決特定問題，但缺乏更深入的說明與比較，很容易讓人覺的結果只是 tune 出來。
主要的價值在基礎教學、展示這方面。
